ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: handedness
Notes: R = Right; L = Left; B = Both; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: 1. What is your native language?
How often do you get dizzy when playing computer games?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Once a month; 3= Once a week; 4= Every other day; 5= Once a day

ElementDescription: When you were younger, how often did you play video games or computergames?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Once a month; 3= Once a week; 4= Every other day; 5= Once a day

ElementDescription: Which video games or computer games did you play?
How often have you played video games or computer games in the past year
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Once a month; 3= Once a week; 4= Every other day; 5= Once a day

ElementDescription: How often do you play 3D video games or computer games?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Once a month; 3= Once a week; 4= Every other day; 5= Once a day

ElementDescription: How often do you play 2D video games or computer games (e.g., Super Mario)?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Once a month; 3= Once a week; 4= Every other day; 5= Once a day

ElementDescription: How often do you use joysticks or game controllers
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Once a month; 3= Once a week; 4= Every other day; 5= Once a day

ElementDescription: Do you ever get physically lost?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you ever feel lost?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you feel you know where you are in the world? (e.g., do you know where you are in the building, and where the building is in Los Angeles, or when you are out walking, you have a feel for where you are.)
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you get lost in small familiar buildings (like a friend's house, corner store, etc.)?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you get lost when you go into large buildings that you've been in before (Malls, office buildings)?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you get lost when you go into large buildings for the first time?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you feel disoriented when you come out of an unfamiliar building?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you feel or get lost when you are in familiar parts of town (like your own neighborhood)?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you feel or get lost when you are in unfamiliar parts of town?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you get people to review a route with you before you'll go that way yourself?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you to stop and ask for directions when you are on your way to someplace (or want to)?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you make up shortcuts and figure out new routes from one place to another?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you forget where you put things?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you have trouble finding your car in a parking lot?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Do you put things like keys and your wallet in specific locations so you can find them again?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: Is it important to you that your clothes and food cupboards are arranged in a very specific way?
Notes: 0= Never; 10= Always

ElementDescription: In an unfamiliar environemtn with no clear landmarks (e.g. forest, desert, new city) and/or low visibility conditions ( e.g. Fog, heavy rain), I still have a good sense of where I am heading.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: If I travel in a novel multi-level building, I can easily imagine the 3D structure of the space.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I tend to judge my orientation in the environment in terms of cardinal directions (north, south, east, west)
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: My mental representation of space reflects realistic, large-scale structural layout of my surrounding environment with relatively accurate distances
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: If I need to return to my origin, it is easier for me to retrace my route than to find a new shortcut
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I usually attempt to visualize a map of the environment from a top-down aerial perspective as I travel
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: It is easy for me to estimate the distance and direction between my moving body and the landmarks I have passed by on the route
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: If I were to return to my origin, I would attempt to find a shortcut based on judging the direction-of-return to the origin rather than retracing my footsteps
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: My mental representation of the route that I traversed is analogous to a schematic map (e.g. floor plan, blue-print, metro map) rather than a first person perspective of routes and landmarks
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I rely primarily on landmarks as signs of turning points along my route of travel.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I have an "internal compass"
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: To reach my destination, I largely recruit a set of procedures telling me the actions to perform (i.e go straight/back, turn left/right) at different locations on my route
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I tend to recontruct my traveled route by imagining abstract spatial relationships amongst different places in a schematic plan rather than by imagining re-walking the route from a 3D first-person perspective.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I usually attempt to mentally represent route segments, turns and their spatial relationships from a top-down aerial perspective
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I remember my route traveled as a succession of different segment lenghts and turns without clear spatial relationships.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I can sense where I am heading even with my eyes closed
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: At any time during a route, I can point back to where I began
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I prefer following directions with descriptions of landmarks turning points rather than using a map
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I have stored mental "snapshots" of landmarks at turning points rather than using a map
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: At any time during a route, I can point back to the landmarks I have passed by
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: If I were to walk on my route again, I would depend heavily on a sequence of mental "snapshots" of landmarks or scenes to go to the places I had been to
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I can easily keep track of my direction of travel on my route with respect to the starting point
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I find it much easier to understand my route procedurally (i.e., where to head and where to turn) than based on forming a map-like mental representation
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: It is very difficult for me to find a shortcute because I think of my route as a sequence of routes and turns
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I find it much easier to recall my route as a set of procedures or actions than as a pattern of spatial relationships
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I rely primarily on a schematic mental representation of my environment to help me in finding shortcuts
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I rely primarily on a schematic mental representation of my environment to figure out my position in the environment
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: Whenever I get lost, I try to reorient myself in relation to the visible landmarks
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I usually rely on a schematic mental representation to orient and navigate to familiar places
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: When I navigate, I pay attention to the landmarks at the turning points and try to remember their sequence
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I visualize my environment in the form of a 3D spatial layout that maintains the spatial relations between my imagined self and surrounding landmakrs/objects
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I have a navigational intuition
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: My mental representation of my traveled route resembles a schematic plan of abstract spatial relationships rather than a pictorial, sequential plan of landmarks/objects
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I keep a mental record of the landmarks I see on my traveling route in a sequential fashion
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I can point to the exit after several turns in a building without relying on a salient landmarks/objects as points of reference.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: To avoid getting lost, I usually try to memorize the landmarks around me along with their associated turns.
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: My mental representation of space primarily involves sequences of route segments and turning points
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: Inside buildings with no salient landmarks/objects to serve as points of reference, I can still sense the direction I am facing
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I can find my way under low visabilty conditions (or even in darkness) in familiar places better than other people
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I can easily point to a sepcific place outside the building when I don't see it from the inside
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: When I imagine reorienting myself on my mental map, I tend to visualize my environment from the top-down ariel perspective and turn my imagined position to the face the new heading
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I know the direction to familiar buildings even when it is blocked from sight by another one
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: I can plan out my routine of travel by visualiznig a schematic map from a top down ariel perspective
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree

ElementDescription: When I reconstruct my mental map, its environmental orientation is fixed and does not change with my inagined heading directions
Notes: 1= Totally Disagreel 2= Somewhat Disagree; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Agree; 5= Totally Agree
